data.description: Built on meritocracy, our unique company culture rewards self-starters and those who are committed to doing what is best for our customers.The Brown & Brown, Inc.’s (B&B) Technology Solutions’ award-winning paid internship program is a project-based experience designed to provide talented undergraduate students an opportunity to contribute meaningful work to our world-class team. As part of a leading global insurance brokerage, the intern role based out of Daytona Beach, FL, will be exposed to a range of learning opportunities, including working with new technologies, developing and troubleshooting system modifications, fostering innovation, and providing application support.In addition to the role’s day-to-day responsibilities, the internship program has been carefully curated for interns to experience our collaborative, teammate-centric culture of Meritocracy that truly makes Brown & Brown a certified Great Places to Work®. The internship experience will include mentorship, teammate partnership, a speaker series, networking opportunities with leadership, and a community engagement project.Brown & Brown is committed to converting high-performing interns into full-time employment opportunities as we continue to look to grow our team of 23,000+ teammates. Our program provides talented students the chance to gain experience in real-world enterprise projects and exposure to learn from our supportive and approachable Technology Solutions team of subject matter experts, all while exploring the opportunity for employment after graduation.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Data gathering, analysis, and reportingExploring Cloud, Security, AI, Data, or Project Management initiativesSupport tasks tied to project milestones, recommendations and collaborating with cross-functional teamsComplete assigned projects and deliverables, presenting recommendations at the conclusion of the internship to leadersActively participate in all internship program elementsPerform duties as assigned by department leadershipCompetencies:Drives Results – Consistently achieve results through meeting timeframes.Customer Focused – Builds strong relationships and delivers customer-centric solutions.Technical Aptitude – Foundational knowledge to perform tasks as directed.Drives Engagement – Helps create a positive and engaging work environment.Cultivates Innovation – Creates new and better ways for internal processes.Decision Quality – Make sound and timely decisions that drive efficient workflows.Preferred Considerations:Involvement in student organizations, project work, tech clubs, hackathons, or competitionsVolunteer work with a technical component or volunteer work that directly gives back to the communityDemonstrated passion for learning and applying emerging technologiesEducation, Experience, and Knowledge:Actively enrolled in an Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree, preferred in a STEM related fieldExpected graduation: December 2026 or laterMinimum GPA: 3.0Posting End Date:24 Oct 2025Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants. Teammate Benefits & Total Well-BeingWe go beyond standard benefits, focusing on the total well-being of our teammates, including:Health Benefits: Medical/Rx, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Disability Insurance Financial Benefits: ESPP; 401k; Student Loan Assistance; Tuition Reimbursement Mental Health & Wellness: Free Mental Health & Enhanced Advocacy ServicesBeyond Benefits: Paid Time Off, Holidays, Preferred Partner Discounts and more. Not reflective of all benefits. Enrollment waiting periods or eligibility criteria may apply to certain benefits. Benefit details and offerings may vary for subsidiary entities or in specific geographic locations.The Power To Be Yourself As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment comprised of people from all backgrounds, with a variety of experiences and perspectives, guided by our Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging (DIB) motto, “The Power to Be Yourself”.
requirements: Actively enrolled in an Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree, preferred in a STEM related field
